title: Toward Robust Non-Transferable Learning: A Survey and Benchmark
author: Ziming Hong (Sydney AI Centre, The University of Sydney), Yongli Xiang (Sydney AI Centre, The University of Sydney), Tongliang Liu (Sydney AI Centre, The University of Sydney), ...
relevance_why: This paper explores non-transferable learning (NTL), which directly impacts model robustness, a relevant aspect for Haohe Liu's work in audio and speech processing, particularly in enhancing model performance against malicious fine-tuning.
background: Non-transferable learning aims to retain performance on a source domain while preventing models from generalizing to harmful or unauthorized target domains.
contribution: This paper introduces the NTLBench framework to systematically evaluate various NTL methods and their robustness against diverse domain transfer attacks, demonstrating significant limitations in existing approaches.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior methods generally focus on improving generalization without addressing the potential for harmful data exploitation or robustness against attacks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically benchmarks NTL methods, providing a comprehensive evaluation of their robustness across multiple datasets and attack settings.

key_innovation: The introduction of NTLBench as a unified benchmarking framework for evaluating the performance of non-transferable learning models and their vulnerability to different attack types.
real_world_impact: The insights from this work could guide the development of machine learning models that are safer and more robust against adversarial attempts, which is crucial for applications in fields like audio processing.
limitations: The paper discusses existing NTL methods' fragility against various post-training attacks, indicating a significant need for improvement in robustness.

new_terms.non-transferable learning: **Non-transferable learning** refers to a learning paradigm aimed at preventing deep learning models from generalizing to specific harmful or unauthorized target domains while maintaining performance on their source domains.
new_terms.NTLBench: **NTLBench** is a benchmarking framework introduced in this paper to systematically evaluate the performance and robustness of non-transferable learning approaches across various datasets and threats.

open_sourcing: The NTLBench framework will be released soon at [https://github.com/tmllab/NTLBench](https://github.com/tmllab/NTLBench).
